title: 111_hr6162
content: The "Coin Modernization, Oversight, and Continuity Act of 2010" authorizes the Secretary of the Treasury to conduct research and development on circulating coins, including testing metallic materials and collaborating with various entities to develop new materials. The Secretary of the Treasury must consider factors such as the impact on coinage material suppliers, ease of use, ability to co-circulate, and compatibility with existing coin acceptance equipment when conducting research and development on new coinage materials. The Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with various stakeholders, considers factors relevant to the public interest when making changes to circulating coins. Additionally, the Secretary is required to provide a biennial report to Congress on coin production costs and alternative content analysis. The Secretary of the Treasury will submit a report to Congress analyzing production costs and trends for circulating coins, along with recommendations for changes in metallic content and production efficiency. The Treasury will provide recommendations to reduce coin production costs and legislative changes needed. Recommendations must not require significant changes to coin-handling equipment. No recommendations will be made for coin specification changes that could allow the use of lower-value coins from other countries or tokens. The Act prohibits the use of tokens or metal devices of minimal value in place of circulating coins. Section 5112 of title 31 is amended to meet the demand for silver and gold numismatic items. Technical corrections are made to section 5112(u)(1) of title 31. The Act makes amendments to section 5112 of title 31 regarding the use of tokens and metal devices. It also addresses the demand for silver and gold numismatic items and includes technical corrections. The budgetary effects of the Act will be determined in compliance with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010.
